head.title: CISCO SYSTEMS TO PAY $210 MILLION FOR REST OF NETIVERSE

identified-content.classifier: Top/Classifieds/Job Market/Job Categories/Technology, Telecommunications and Internet

hedline.hl1: CISCO SYSTEMS TO PAY $210 MILLION FOR REST OF NETIVERSE

abstract.p: Cisco Systems agrees to pay about $210 million in stock for remaining 80 percent of Netiverse Inc which it does not already own (S)

block.p: Cisco Systems Inc., the maker of Internet networking equipment, agreed yesterday to pay around $210 million in stock for the remainder of Netiverse Inc., which makes technology that speeds networking devices. Cisco already holds a 20 percent stake in the privately held Netiverse. Cisco said the acquisition would strengthen its content networking solutions. Shares of Cisco rose 62.5 cents, to $65.1875, in Nasdaq trading. Cisco Systems is the world's top provider of products that link networks and power the Internet. Both companies are based in San Jose, Calif.
